title: Is it true that Bill Gates refused to vaccinate his children? - Quora

response.answer_text: Nope. That particular claim seems to come from an article, written under a pseudonym, on a website called “NewsPunch” (which is notorious for made-up stories), which claims that someone leaked a tape from a symposium in which the Gates family doctor said Bill Gates refused to have his kids vaccinated. So, a website that has no concern about accuracy publishes an anonymous article which claims that somebody (and we have no idea who) heard these remarks from an unnamed doctor in an unspecified symposium. Also, the website has since deleted the article. False claim: Bill Gates refused to vaccinate his children Sounds legit! This claim is the perfect example of how fake stories function. It’s absolute nonsense, but it sounds vaguely plausible. So someone wrote it up, every anti-vax website in the world picked up up, because it backed up what they already believed, and the next thing you know, it’s all over the internet. Is it accurate? Who cares! If you want to believe it, you won’t look too close. And everyone’s saying it, so there must be something there! And this is not an uncommon thing. It appears to be an article of faith in the antivax community that doctors, pharmaceutical executives and vaccination advocates don’t vaccinate their own children. To the point where all of those groups, when holding public meetings, will almost inevitable encounter a smug anti-vaxxer who asks them “but are your children vaccinated”. I suppose they’re hoping that the person will either dodge the question, or be shocked to be caught in their own web of lies. What happens in real life, in almost one hundred percent of cases, is that the person responds that OF COURSE their children are vaccinated, because that’s one of the basic things every parent should do to keep their children safe. I assume the anti-vaxxers then just assume that they’re lying. For the record, the Gates family has spoken publicly about vaccinating their own children. But I’m sure an anonymous guy on the interwebs knows better than them. Melinda Gates

They have both openly talked about vaccinating. To claim they didn’t would mean believing they both lied and convinced their children to go along with it. Any reasons put forth by the conspiracy theorists as to why they would do such a thing have so many holes they can’t hold a drop of water.
